name: gsl
description:
The GNU Scientific Library (GSL) is a numerical library for C and C++
programmers. It is free software under the GNU General Public License.
The library provides a wide range of mathematical routines such as
random number generators, special functions and least-squares fitting.
There are over 1000 functions in total with an extensive test suite.

dependencies.name: m4
dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.

dependencies.name: autoconf
dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools

dependencies.name: automake
dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools

dependencies.name: libtool
dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.

dependencies.name: blas
dependencies.description:
AMD Optimized BLIS. BLIS is a portable software framework for
instantiating high-performance BLAS-like dense linear algebra libraries.
The framework was designed to isolate essential kernels of computation
that, when optimized, immediately enable optimized implementations of
most of its commonly used and computationally intensive operations.

dependent_to.name: msmc
dependent_to.description:
This software implements MSMC, a method to infer population size and
gene flow from multiple genome sequences

dependent_to.name: py-faststructure
dependent_to.description:
FastStructure is a fast algorithm for inferring population structure
from large SNP genotype data.

dependent_to.name: nest
dependent_to.description:
NEST is a simulator for spiking neural network models It focuses on the
dynamics, size and structure of neural systems rather than on the exact
morphology of individual neurons.

dependent_to.name: ape
dependent_to.description:
A tool for generating atomic pseudopotentials within a Density-
Functional Theory framework

dependent_to.name: root
dependent_to.description: ROOT is a data analysis framework.

dependent_to.name: preseq
dependent_to.description:
The preseq package is aimed at predicting and estimating the complexity
of a genomic sequencing library, equivalent to predicting and estimating
the number of redundant reads from a given sequencing depth and how many
will be expected from additional sequencing using an initial sequencing
experiment.

dependent_to.name: msmc2
dependent_to.description:
This program implements MSMC2, a method to infer population size
history and population separation history from whole genome sequencing
data.

dependent_to.name: unuran
dependent_to.description: Universal Non-Uniform Random number generator.

dependent_to.name: octopus
dependent_to.description:
A real-space finite-difference (time-dependent) density-functional
theory code.

dependent_to.name: lorene
dependent_to.description:
LORENE: Langage Objet pour la RElativite NumeriquE LORENE is a set of
C++ classes to solve various problems arising in numerical relativity,
and more generally in computational astrophysics. It provides tools to
solve partial differential equations by means of multi-domain spectral
methods.

dependent_to.name: flecsph
dependent_to.description:
FleCSPH is a multi-physics compact application that exercises FleCSI
parallel data structures for tree-based particle methods. In particular,
FleCSPH implements a smoothed-particle hydrodynamics (SPH) solver for
the solution of Lagrangian problems in astrophysics and cosmology.
FleCSPH includes support for gravitational forces using the fast
multipole method (FMM).

dependent_to.name: votca-tools
dependent_to.description:
Versatile Object-oriented Toolkit for Coarse-graining Applications
(VOTCA) is a package intended to reduce the amount of routine work when
doing systematic coarse-graining of various systems. The core is written
in C++. This package contains the basic tools library of VOTCA.

dependent_to.name: pktools
dependent_to.description: Processing Kernel for geospatial data

dependent_to.name: sirius
dependent_to.description: Domain specific library for electronic structure calculations

dependent_to.name: qgis
dependent_to.description:
QGIS is a free and open-source cross-platform desktop geographic
information system application that supports viewing, editing, and
analysis of geospatial data.

dependent_to.name: pism
dependent_to.description: Parallel Ice Sheet Model

dependent_to.name: dysco
dependent_to.description: Dysco is a compressing storage manager for Casacore mearement sets.

dependent_to.name: pnfft
dependent_to.description:
PNFFT is a parallel software library for the calculation of three-
dimensional nonequispaced FFTs.

dependent_to.name: dealii
dependent_to.description:
C++ software library providing well-documented tools to build finite
element codes for a broad variety of PDEs.

dependent_to.name: fgsl
dependent_to.description: Fortran interface to the GNU Scientific Library

dependent_to.name: rivet
dependent_to.description: Rivet - the particle-physics MC analysis toolkit

dependent_to.name: meep
dependent_to.description:
Meep (or MEEP) is a free finite-difference time-domain (FDTD) simulation
software package developed at MIT to model electromagnetic systems.

dependent_to.name: thepeg
dependent_to.description: Toolkit for High Energy Physics Event Generation

dependent_to.name: py-cvxopt
dependent_to.description:
CVXOPT is a free software package for convex optimization based on the
Python programming language.

dependent_to.name: unblur
dependent_to.description:
Unblur is used to align the frames of movies recorded on an electron
microscope to reduce image blurring due to beam-induced motion.

dependent_to.name: draco
dependent_to.description:
Draco is an object-oriented component library geared towards numerically
intensive, radiation (particle) transport applications built for
parallel computing hardware. It consists of semi-independent packages
and a robust build system.

dependent_to.name: octave-gsl
dependent_to.description: Octave bindings to the GNU Scientific Library

dependent_to.name: mash
dependent_to.description: Fast genome and metagenome distance estimation using MinHash.

dependent_to.name: andi
dependent_to.description:
andi is used for for estimating the evolutionary distance between
closely related genomes.

dependent_to.name: vbfnlo
dependent_to.description:
VBFNLO is a fully flexible parton level Monte Carlo program for the
simulation of vector boson fusion, double and triple vector boson
production in hadronic collisions at next to leading order in the strong
coupling constant.

dependent_to.name: gnuradio
dependent_to.description:
GNU Radio is a free & open-source software development toolkit that
provides signal processing blocks to implement software radios. It can
be used with readily-available, low-cost external RF hardware to create
software-defined radios, or without hardware in a simulation-like
environment. It is widely used in hobbyist, academic, and commercial
environments to support both wireless communications research and real-
world radio systems.

dependent_to.name: r-gsl
dependent_to.description:
An R wrapper for some of the functionality of the Gnu Scientific
Library.

dependent_to.name: r-dirichletmultinomial
dependent_to.description:
Dirichlet-Multinomial Mixture Model Machine Learning for Microbiome Data
Dirichlet-multinomial mixture models can be used to describe variability
in microbial metagenomic data. This package is an interface to code
originally made available by Holmes, Harris, and Quince, 2012, PLoS ONE
7(2): 1-15, as discussed further in the man page for this package,
?DirichletMultinomial.

dependent_to.name: gaudi
dependent_to.description: An experiment-independent HEP event data processing framework

dependent_to.name: viennarna
dependent_to.description:
The ViennaRNA Package consists of a C code library and several stand-
alone programs for the prediction and comparison of RNA secondary
structures.

dependent_to.name: ea-utils
dependent_to.description:
Command-line tools for processing biological sequencing data. Barcode
demultiplexing, adapter trimming, etc. Primarily written to support an
Illumina based pipeline - but should work with any FASTQs.

dependent_to.name: r-diversitree
dependent_to.description:
Comparative 'Phylogenetic' Analyses of Diversification Mostly focusing
on analysing diversification and character evolution. Contains
implementations of 'BiSSE' (Binary State 'Speciation' and Extinction)
and its unresolved tree extensions, 'MuSSE' (Multiple State 'Speciation'
and Extinction), 'QuaSSE', 'GeoSSE', and 'BiSSE-ness' Other included
methods include Markov models of discrete and continuous trait evolution
and constant rate 'speciation' and extinction.

dependent_to.name: bcftools
dependent_to.description:
BCFtools is a set of utilities that manipulate variant calls in the
Variant Call Format (VCF) and its binary counterpart BCF. All commands
work transparently with both VCFs and BCFs, both uncompressed and BGZF-
compressed.

dependent_to.name: kadath
dependent_to.description:
KADATH SPECTRAL SOLVER. The Frankfurt University/Kadath (FUKA) Initial
Data solver branch is a collection of ID solvers aimed at delivering
consistent initial data (ID) solutions to the eXtended Conformal Thin-
Sandwich (XCTS) formulation of Einstein's field equations for a variety
of compact object configurations to include extremely compact,
asymmetric, and mixed spin binaries.

dependent_to.name: pagmo
dependent_to.description:
Parallel Global Multiobjective Optimizer (and its Python alter ego
PyGMO) is a C++ / Python platform to perform parallel computations of
optimisation tasks (global and local) via the asynchronous generalized
island model.

dependent_to.name: plumed
dependent_to.description:
PLUMED is an open source library for free energy calculations in
molecular systems which works together with some of the most popular
molecular dynamics engines. Free energy calculations can be performed as
a function of many order parameters with a particular focus on
biological problems, using state of the art methods such as
metadynamics, umbrella sampling and Jarzynski-equation based steered MD.
The software, written in C++, can be easily interfaced with both fortran
and C/C++ codes.

dependent_to.name: herwig3
dependent_to.description: Herwig is a multi-purpose particle physics event generator.

dependent_to.name: votca-ctp
dependent_to.description:
Versatile Object-oriented Toolkit for Coarse-graining Applications
(VOTCA) is a package intended to reduce the amount of routine work when
doing systematic coarse-graining of various systems. The core is written
in C++. This package contains the VOTCA charge transport engine.

dependent_to.name: herwigpp
dependent_to.description:
Herwig is a multi-purpose particle physics event generator. This package
provides old Herwig++ 2 generator

dependent_to.name: ampliconnoise
dependent_to.description:
AmpliconNoise is a collection of programs for the removal of noise from
454 sequenced PCR amplicons.

dependent_to.name: gdl
dependent_to.description:
A free and open-source IDL/PV-WAVE compiler. GNU Data Language (GDL) is
a free/libre/open source incremental compiler compatible with IDL and to
some extent with PV-WAVE.

dependent_to.name: genie
dependent_to.description: Genie is a neutrino Monte Carlo Generator.

dependent_to.name: nco
dependent_to.description:
The NCO toolkit manipulates and analyzes data stored in netCDF-
accessible formats

dependent_to.name: augustus
dependent_to.description:
AUGUSTUS is a program that predicts genes in eukaryotic genomic
sequences

dependent_to.name: relax
dependent_to.description:
A set of Reflex libraries for the most common used general data types in
the LHC Computing Grid

dependent_to.name: n2p2
dependent_to.description:
N2p2 (The neural network potential package) provides ready-to-use
software for high-dimensional neural network potentials in computational
physics and chemistry.

dependent_to.name: hmmer
dependent_to.description:
HMMER is used for searching sequence databases for sequence homologs,
and for making sequence alignments. It implements methods using
probabilistic models called profile hidden Markov models (profile HMMs).

dependent_to.name: admixtools
dependent_to.description:
The ADMIXTOOLS package implements 5 methods described in Patterson et
al. (2012) Ancient Admixture in Human History. Details of the methods
and algorithm can be found in this paper..

dependent_to.name: chgcentre
dependent_to.description:
The chgcentre tool can be used to change the phase centre of a
measurement set.
